| History                 = The Spanish Kings was one of the two largest gangs in [[Chicago (Illinois)|Chicago]]. They were locked in a war against the other big gang, the [[Southstone Rangers (Earth-616)|Southstone Rangers]]. In an attempt to defuse the gang situation, [[Samuel Wilson (Earth-616)|Falcon]] had his apprentice [[Rayshaun Lucas (Earth-616)|Patriot]] approach the Southstone Rangers to convince them to work out a truce with their enemies, the Kings' leader, [[Character Index/O#Ortiz|Ortiz]], heard him out. Unfortunately, the day when both gangs gathered to call truce, the leader of the Southstone Rangers, [[Dray (Gangster) (Earth-616)|Dray]], instead shot the Spanish King's leader point blank in the head in front of Falcon, and chaos ensued.{{r|Falcon Vol 2 1}}

| Trivia                  = The Spanish Kings are an obvious stand-in for the infamous Latino super-gang in Chicago, the Latin Kings.
